page.title: 03NEW HOUSING IN MARLBOROUGH
page.content:
Marlborough Borough Council, Kennet District Council and a local building firm called Rendells have collaborated in a successful joint venture. Small houses, often referred to as "starter homes" were built on the eastern edge of a council estate called Portfields, and were occupied in the first six months of 1984. Those eligible for this scheme (called Roger's Meadow) were:
a) already living in a council house,
b) on the waiting list or
c) a first time buyer already living in Marlborough. Sanctions in respect of re-sale and extensions were imposed.
